title: Is the term “black plague” racist? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m 90% sure you’re a right wing troll, but I’ll answer the question. No, it isn’t. The word “Black” in this context refers to the black pustules that grow out of the victim’s lymph nodes, colloquially referred to as “boobos”. That is actually the origin of the technical name for the disease, the “Bubonic Plague”, and might be the origin of the word “boob”.

In the movie Malcolm X, there’s a dialogue where Malcolm X argues many words that begin with “black” as racist. Blackmail was one I recall. The cancel culture is going nuts right now though. In Oregon, the traditional in state rivalry game is dropping the title “Civil War” even though civil war is a general term for any domestic war. The one fought in the US from 1861–65 was just one of hundreds of civil wars fought around the globe. Based upon this and countless other nutty proposals, I wouldn’t be surprised to see “black plague” get scrubbed to a more PC term. Sad.
